intro: Koilodepas laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth-leafed koilodepas, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
